document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the South African endemic bee genus Redivivoides Michener, 1981 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Melittidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the South African endemic bee genus Redivivoides Michener, 1981 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Melittidae)

taxonomicName.materialsCitation: Michener, 1981: 121-122 , figs 80, 82-84 (p. 43), 97 (p. 48), Holotype ♀ (type locality: Clanwilliam , South Africa ) ( Snow Entomological Museum , University of Kansas , Lawrence ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Females of
R. simulans
can be separated from other
Redivivoides
species by a combination of the following characters: metasomal terga at least partly red (at least on a narrow stripe on the apical part of the discs of T1 – T3), metasomal terga with surface between punctures smooth and shiny ( Fig. 12D ), scutum at least on the disc between punctures smooth and shiny ( Fig. 12C ), and head about as long as wide ( Fig. 12B ). These characters also apply to males ( Fig. 13C ) but genitalia and S6 – S8 ( Fig. 13 D–H) should be checked to avoid potential confusion with the unknown male of
R. kamieskroonensis
.

Both sexes of
R. simulans
were described in detail by Michener (1981) .

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 12.
Redivivoides simulans Michener, 1981
, ♀. A . Lateral view. B . Head. C . Scutum and scutellum. D . Metasoma (dorsal view). Scale bar: 1 mm.

Fig. 13.
Redivivoides simulans Michener, 1981
, ♂. A . Lateral view. B . Scutum and scutellum. C . Metasoma (dorsal view). D . S6 (ventral view). E . S7 (dorsal view). F . S8, apical end (backscattered electron image). G . Genitalia (dorsal view). H . Genitalia (lateral view). Scale bar: 1 mm.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 14. Distribution of
Redivivoides simulans Michener, 1981
in South Africa.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This is the most common and widespread of all
Redivivoides
species and has been found in most parts of the winter rainfall area ( Fig. 14 ).

Asphodelaceae :
Trachyandra muricata
; Brassicaceae :
Heliophila
spec.; Fabaceae :
Indigofera
spec.,
Lebeckia
spec.,
Lessertia rigida
,
Lotonotis hirsuta
(=
serpens
); Fumariaceae :

; Hyacinthaceae :
Lachenalia mutabilis
; Iridaceae :

,
M. ramosissima
,
Moraea
spec.; Scrophulariaceae :
Nemesia affinis
,
N. versicolor
,
Nemesia
spec.,

(=
seluginoides
); Sterculiaceae :

spec.
